programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Boston cut its series deficit in half with a 115-93 win over New York in Game 3 behind 23 points from Payton Pritchard off the bench, along with 22 points and seven assists from Jayson Tatum; Jalen Brunson led the Knicks with 27 points in the loss.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Minnesota gained a 2-1 lead in the series with a 102-97 win over Golden State in Game 3 behind 36 points from Anthony Edwards and a triple-double from Julius Randle; Jimmy Butler led the Warriors with 33 points and seven assists in the loss.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: The complete NFL schedule for the 2025 season is unveiled, as analysts break down the path to Super Bowl LX for the 32 NFL teams, discussing which teams may have the hardest road to get there and which teams benefit from an easier schedule.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Arizona ranks fourth in MLB in home runs this season; San Francisco's Justin Verlander (0-2, 4.50) allowed three runs on five hits and recorded three strikeouts over 5.0 innings for a no-decision in a 14-5 win over the Cubs in 11 innings on May 6.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Arizona ranks fourth in MLB in home runs this season; San Francisco's Justin Verlander (0-2, 4.50) allowed three runs on five hits and recorded three strikeouts over 5.0 innings for a no-decision in a 14-5 win over the Cubs in 11 innings on May 6.

programme.title: MLB on FS1 Pregame
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming MLB games, looking at the pitching matchups, evaluating key players on each team and assessing which players might have the biggest impact; coverage includes interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Defending Cup Series champion Joey Logano secured his first win of the season with his victory at Texas over Ross Chastain; Kyle Larson and Chastain won the two races at Kansas last year over Chris Buescher and current points leader William Byron.

programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased his lead over Christian Lundgaard to 60 points after winning at Barber for his third win in the first four races; Palou averaged 118 mph en route to his win last year over Will Power.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
UFL Football
programme.desc: Arlington (3-2) defeated the Battlehawks, 30-15, on April 19 behind 149 passing yards and a touchdown from Luis Perez and a rushing TD from Dae Dae Hunter; St. Louis (3-2) is 2-1 at home after a 32-27 win over Michigan on April 26.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
UFL Football
programme.desc: Michigan (4-2) rebounded from its loss to St. Louis with a 38-14 win over DC behind three total touchdowns from Bryce Perkins; Arlington (3-3) dropped its last two games since beating St. Louis, 30-15, on April 19 behind Luis Perez.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (4-2) dropped two of its last three games after a 38-14 loss to Michigan; San Antonio (1-5) lost two-straight games since defeating the Defenders, 24-18, on April 20 behind two rushing TDs from Aidan Robbins and a passing TD from Kellen Mond.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Alex Marquez moved into first place and gained a one-point lead over his six-time MotoGP champion brother, Marc, after winning at Spain for his first MotoGP win of his career; Jorge Martin won the grand prix race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased his lead over Christian Lundgaard to 60 points after winning at Barber for his third win in the first four races; Palou averaged 118 mph en route to his win last year over Will Power.

programme.desc: Alex Marquez moved into first place and gained a one-point lead over his six-time MotoGP champion brother, Marc, after winning at Spain for his first MotoGP win of his career; Jorge Martin won the grand prix race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: The Rover of Tobruk
